intro: Guajava elegans, commonly known as the elegant guajava, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces dark purple berries that are edible and have a sweet, tart flavor. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its glossy foliage and compact growth habit. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires partial to full sunlight for optimal growth.
